did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for use without restrictions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Box/folder, Poetry Society of Virginia Archives, M 53, Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collections were donated to the Special Collections and Archives Department in several sections over the years. In 1967, RPI was selected to house a proposed collection of Virginia poetry. In 1968, the collection reached 158 volumes. The archival collection has been augumented several times, most notably by Emma Gray Trigg (l976) and Mrs. D. M. Zimmerman (1977). The Department initiated ongoing negotiations with Mrs. Bess Gresham in August 1989 to transfer the more recent materials to the Archives. The book collection consists of approximately 350 volumes at the last inventory.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection was processed in October 1986 and revised in June 1990.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Founded in 1923 at the College of William and Mary by Dr. Feidelson, the Poetry Society of Virginia's first members were from the Tidewater area, although Richmonders soon played a vital role within the organization. The purpose of the organization is to encourage the composition, study and general appreciation of poetry. The Society continues to sponsor poetry readings and annual writing competitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Poetry Society of Virginia Archives is divided into three segments: 1) correspondence and business matters concerning the Society (l964-l981), 2) personal papers and works of various artists and writers (l910-1960) and 3) a book collection sponsored by the Society. All are housed in the Special Collections and Archives Department.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The Poetry Society of Virginia Archives is divided into three segments: 1) correspondence and business matters concerning the Society (l964-l981), 2) personal papers and works of various artists and writers (l910-1960) and 3) a book collection sponsored by the Society. All are housed in the Special Collections and Archives Department.
